Body: I'm learning Arabic right now, and the Arabs seem to all hold this book in high regard. Obviously, many for merely religious reasons. However, I've found numerous people that reference it as some sort of perfected grammar. Is there any reason, linguistically, to hold this book in such high regard? Aside from its mythological value.
Title: The Koran: anything special about this book linguistically?

LastEditedUser.AboutMe: Self-taught programmer, freelancer, large-scale data miner and cruncher, web developer, linguist.
